title: Pain Management Alternatives
cleaned_text: At Community's integrative medicine program, our specialists deliver personalized care that combines traditional methods with complementary care, such as [acupuncture](/services/integrative-medicine/acupuncture), cupping, blading therapy and herbalism. This approach offers patients alternative options so they don't have to rely as much on medications with potential side effects. If you are a cancer patient experiencing unpleasant side effects from chemo treatment, or suffer from common conditions such as hypertension, diabetes, and chronic headaches, integrative practices may help. For patients currently taking medications, treatment guidance involves the patient's entire care team, to ensure recommendations work within a patient's existing medication regimen. Learn more about using holistic integrative techniques to manage pain in our blog. [Integrative Care Blog](/healthminute/2022/integrative-medicine-best-both-worlds) Meet Our Specialist Dr. Young Park is trained in both family and integrative medicine, with special interests in pain management, preventive medicine, Eastern medicine, osteopathic manipulation and functional medicine.
